benchmark_details.name: BioMol-MQA: A Multi-Modal Question Answering Dataset For LLM Reasoning Over Bio-Molecular Interactions
benchmark_details.overview: BioMol-MQA is a new question-answering (QA) dataset on polypharmacy, composed of a multimodal knowledge graph with text and molecular structure for information retrieval and challenging questions designed to test LLM capabilities in retrieving and reasoning over multimodal data.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate models for handling complex, real-world medical queries involving multi-modal reasoning.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset is limited to drugs that have both text and SMILES representation; otherwise, relevant proteins only have text, creating potential imbalances.

data.source: A multimodal knowledge graph with drug-drug and drug-protein interactions along with text and SMILES for each drug.
data.annotation: Manually generated questions integrated with multimodal data.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated by comparing generated model outputs to ground truth.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better model performance in answering questions accurately.
methodology.baseline_results: Results on existing LLMs that show improvement with multimodal context.
methodology.validation: Dataset validated through human evaluators and LLM performance metrics.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Questions crafted to explore reasoning across demographics in healthcare.
targeted_risks.harm: Potential misinformation leading to adverse health decisions if models misinterpret complex queries.
